.. _`pcaExplorer PCA Correlation`:

PCAEXPLORER PCA CORRELATION
===========================

Plot PCA axes correlations





Example
-------

This meta-wrapper can be used in the following way:

.. code-block:: python

    rule test_pcaexplorer_pcacorrs:
        input:
            dst = "vst.RDS",
            dds = "dds.RDS"
        output:
            png = "plot.png"
        message:
            "Testing pcaExplorer PCA Correlations"
        threads:
            1
        resources:
            mem_mb = (
                lambda wildcards, attempt: min(attempt * 1024, 10240)
            ),
            time_min = (
                lambda wildcards, attempt: min(attempt * 20, 200)
            )
        log:
            "logs/test_pcaexplorer_pcacorrs.log"
        wrapper:
            "0.66.0-240-gd9cffe8c/bio/pcaExplorer/plotCorrs"


Note that input, output and log file paths can be chosen freely.
When running with

.. code-block:: bash

    snakemake --use-conda

the software dependencies will be automatically deployed into an isolated environment before execution.



Notes
-----

Parameters:

* extra (str) Command line arguments (interpreted by R)




Authors
-------


* Thibault Dayris



Code
----
